verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the bloody<WH1818> city<WH5892>! it is all full<WH4392> of lies<WH3585> and rapine<WH6563>; the prey<WH2964> departeth not<WH4185>.
The noise<WH6963> of the whip<WH7752>, and the noise<WH6963> of the rattling<WH7494> of wheels<WH212>, and prancing<WH1725> horses<WH5483>, and bounding<WH7540> chariots<WH4818>,

the horseman<WH6571> mounting<WH5927>, and the flashing<WH1300> sword<WH2719>, and the glittering<WH1300> spear<WH2595>, and a multitude<WH7230> of slain<WH2491>, and a great<WH3514> heap of corpses<WH6297>, and there is no end<WH7097> of the bodies<WH6297>; they stumble<WH3782> upon their bodies<WH1472>;â€”

because of the multitude<WH7230> of the whoredoms<WH2183> of the well-favored<WH2896> harlot<WH2181>, the mistress<WH1172> of witchcrafts<WH3785>, that selleth<WH4376> nations<WH1471> through her whoredoms<WH2183>, and families<WH4940> through her witchcrafts<WH3785>.

Behold <WH5002>, I am against thee, saith Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, and I will uncover<WH1540> thy skirts<WH7757> upon thy face<WH6440>; and I will show<WH7200> the nations<WH1471> thy nakedness<WH4626>, and the kingdoms<WH4467> thy shame<WH7036>.
And I will cast<WH7993> abominable filth<WH8251> upon thee<WH5034>, and make thee vile, and will set<WH7760> thee as a gazing-stock<WH7210>.

And it shall come to pass<WH7200>, that all they that look upon thee shall flee<WH5074> from thee<WH559>, and say, Nineveh<WH5210> is laid waste<WH7703>: who will bemoan<WH5110> her<WH370>? whence shall I seek<WH1245> comforters for thee<WH5162>?

Art thou better<WH3190> than No<WH4996> - amon<WH527>, that was situate<WH3427> among the rivers<WH2975>, that had the waters<WH4325> round about<WH5439> her<WH2426>; whose rampart was the sea<WH3220>, and her wall<WH2346> was of the sea<WH3220>?
Ethiopia <WH3568> and Egypt<WH4714> were her strength<WH6109>, and it was infinite<WH369>; Put<WH6316> and Lubim<WH3864> were thy helpers<WH5833>.

Yet was she carried away<WH1473>, she went<WH1980> into captivity<WH7628>; her young children<WH5768> also were dashed in pieces<WH7376> at the head<WH7218> of all the streets<WH2351>; and they cast<WH3032> lots<WH1486> for her honorable men<WH3513>, and all her great men<WH1419> were bound<WH7576> in chains<WH2131>.
Thou also shalt be drunken<WH7937>; thou shalt be hid<WH5956>; thou also shalt seek<WH1245> a stronghold<WH4581> because of the enemy<WH341>.
All thy fortresses<WH4013> shall be like fig-trees<WH8384> with the first-ripe<WH1061> figs: if they be shaken<WH5128>, they fall<WH5307> into the mouth<WH6310> of the eater<WH398>.

Behold <WH5971>, thy people in the midst<WH7130> of thee are women<WH802>; the gates<WH8179> of thy land<WH776> are set wide<WH6605> open<WH6605> unto thine enemies<WH341>: the fire<WH784> hath devoured<WH398> thy bars<WH1280>.

Draw <WH7579> thee water<WH4325> for the siege<WH4692>; strengthen<WH2388> thy fortresses<WH4013>; go<WH935> into the clay<WH2916>, and tread<WH7429> the mortar<WH2563>; make strong<WH2388> the brickkiln<WH4404>.

There shall the fire<WH784> devour<WH398> thee<WH2719>; the sword shall cut thee off<WH3772>; it shall devour<WH398> thee like the canker-worm<WH3218>: make thyself many<WH3513> as the canker-worm<WH3218>; make thyself many<WH3513> as the locust<WH697>.
Thou hast multiplied<WH7235> thy merchants<WH7402> above the stars<WH3556> of heaven<WH8064>: the canker-worm<WH3218> ravageth<WH6584>, and fleeth away<WH5774>.

Thy princes<WH4502> are as the locusts<WH697>, and thy marshals<WH2951> as the swarms of grasshoppers<WH1462>, which encamp<WH2583> in the hedges<WH1448> in the cold<WH7135> day<WH3117>, but when the sun<WH8121> ariseth<WH2224> they flee away<WH5074>, and their place<WH4725> is not known<WH3045> where they are<WH335>.

Thy shepherds<WH7462> slumber<WH5123>, O king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>; thy nobles<WH117> are at rest<WH7931>; thy people<WH5971> are scattered<WH6335> upon the mountains<WH2022>, and there is none to gather them<WH6908>.

There is no assuaging<WH3545> of thy hurt<WH7667>: thy wound<WH4347> is grievous<WH2470>: all that hear<WH8085> the report<WH8088> of thee clap<WH8628> their hands<WH3709> over thee<WH7451>; for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed<WH5674> continually<WH8548>?
